section.programlisting: 00001 *CMZ : 2.03/06 17/08/96 17.17.38 by Federico Carminati 00002 *-- Author : Federico Carminati 21/06/96 00003 #ifdef HPUX 00004 SUBROUTINE xnrand(RVEC,LENV) 00005 * Thread-private random number generator, if the run 00006 * is not parallel, always call the first. 00007 ith=my_thread() 00008 IF(ith.EQ.0) THEN 00009 CALL xnrand1(rvec,lenv) 00010 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.1) THEN 00011 CALL xnrand2(rvec,lenv) 00012 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.2) THEN 00013 CALL xnrand3(rvec,lenv) 00014 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.3) THEN 00015 CALL xnrand4(rvec,lenv) 00016 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.4) THEN 00017 CALL xnrand5(rvec,lenv) 00018 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.5) THEN 00019 CALL xnrand6(rvec,lenv) 00020 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.6) THEN 00021 CALL xnrand7(rvec,lenv) 00022 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.7) THEN 00023 CALL xnrand8(rvec,lenv) 00024 ENDIF 00025 * 00026 END 00027 SUBROUTINE xnrngo(LUX,INSEED) 00028 * Thread-private random number generator, if the run 00029 * is not parallel, always call the first. 00030 ith=my_thread() 00031 IF(ith.EQ.0) THEN 00032 CALL xnrngo1(lux,inseed) 00033 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.1) THEN 00034 CALL xnrngo2(lux,inseed) 00035 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.2) THEN 00036 CALL xnrngo3(lux,inseed) 00037 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.3) THEN 00038 CALL xnrngo4(lux,inseed) 00039 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.4) THEN 00040 CALL xnrngo5(lux,inseed) 00041 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.5) THEN 00042 CALL xnrngo6(lux,inseed) 00043 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.6) THEN 00044 CALL xnrngo7(lux,inseed) 00045 ELSE IF(ith.EQ.7) THEN 00046 CALL xnrngo8(lux,inseed) 00047 ENDIF 00048 * 00049 END 00050 * 00051 SUBROUTINE xnrand1(RVEC,LENV) 00052 C SUBROUTINE RANLUX(RVEC,LENV) 00053 C Subtract-and-borrow random number generator proposed by 00054 C Marsaglia and Zaman, implemented by F. James with the name 00055 C RCARRY in 1991, and later improved by Martin Luescher 00056 C in 1993 to produce "Luxury Pseudorandom Numbers". 00057 C Fortran 77 coded by F. James, 1993 00058 C 00059 C LUXURY LEVELS. 00060 C ------ ------ The available luxury levels are: 00061 C 00062 C level 0 (p=24): equivalent to the original RCARRY of Marsaglia 00063 C and Zaman, very long period, but fails many tests. 00064 C level 1 (p=48): considerable improvement in quality over level 0, 00065 C now passes the gap test, but still fails spectral test. 00066 C level 2 (p=97): passes all known tests, but theoretically still 00067 C defective. 00068 C level 3 (p=223): DEFAULT VALUE. Any theoretically possible 00069 C correlations have very small chance of being observed. 00070 C level 4 (p=389): highest possible luxury, all 24 bits chaotic. 00071 C 00072 C!!! ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ 00073 C!!! Calling sequences for RANLUX: ++ 00074 C!!! CALL RANLUX (RVEC, LEN) returns a vector RVEC of LEN ++ 00075 C!!! 32-bit random floating point numbers between ++ 00076 C!!! zero (not included) and one (also not incl.). ++ 00077 C!!! CALL RLUXGO(LUX,INT) initializes the generator from one ++ 00078 C!!! 32-bit integer INT and sets Luxury Level LUX ++ 00079 C!!! which is integer between zero and MAXLEV, ++ 00080 C!!! or if LUX .GT. 24, it sets p=LUX directly ++ 00081 C!!! CALL RLUXIN(IVEC) restarts the generator from vector ++ 00082 C!!! IVEC of 25 32-bit integers (see RLUXUT) ++ 00083 C!!! CALL RLUXUT(IVEC) outputs the current values of the 25 ++ 00084 C!!! 32-bit integer seeds, to be used for restarting ++ 00085 C!!! ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ 00086 dimension rvec(lenv) 00087 dimension seeds(24), iseeds(24), isdext(25) 00088 parameter(maxlev=4, lxdflt=3) 00089 dimension ndskip(0:maxlev) 00090 parameter(twop12=4096.) 00091 parameter(itwo24=2**24, icons=2147483563) 00092 SAVE notyet, i24, j24, carry, seeds, twom24, twom12, luxlev 00093 SAVE nskip, ndskip, in24 00094 INTEGER LUXLEV 00095 LOGICAL NOTYET 00096 DATA notyet, luxlev, in24 /.true., lxdflt, 0/ 00097 DATA i24,j24,carry/24,10,0./ 00098 DATA ndskip/0, 24, 73, 199, 365 / 00099 Corresponds to p=24 48 97 223 389 00100 C time factor 1 2 4 9 16 (in practice, much smaller) 00101 C 00102 C NOTYET is .TRUE. if no initialization has been performed yet. 00103 C Default Initialization by Multiplicative Congruential 00104 IF (notyet) THEN 00105 notyet = .false. 00106 jseed = 314159265 00107 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRAND: default initialisation '',I12)') jseed 00108 luxlev = lxdflt 00109 nskip = ndskip(luxlev) 00110 lp = nskip + 24 00111 in24 = 0 00112 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRAND: default level '',I2,'', p '',I4)') 00113 + luxlev, lp 00114 twom24 = 1. 00115 DO 10 i= 1, 24 00116 twom24 = twom24 * 0.5 00117 k = jseed/53668 00118 jseed = 40014*(jseed-k*53668) -k*12211 00119 IF (jseed .LT. 0) jseed = jseed+icons 00120 iseeds(i) = mod(jseed,itwo24) 00121 10 CONTINUE 00122 twom12 = twom24 * 4096. 00123 DO 20 i= 1,24 00124 seeds(i) = real(iseeds(i))*twom24 00125 20 CONTINUE 00126 i24 = 24 00127 j24 = 10 00128 carry = 0. 00129 IF (seeds(24) .LE. seeds(14)) carry = twom24 00130 ENDIF 00131 C 00132 C The Generator proper: "Subtract-with-borrow", 00133 C as proposed by Marsaglia and Zaman, 00134 C Florida State University, March, 1989 00135 C 00136 DO 40 ivec= 1, lenv 00137 CCCCCC This has now been corrected for the bug discovered by Luescher *** 00138 uni = seeds(j24) - seeds(i24) - carry 00139 CCCCCC This has now been corrected for the bug discovered by Luescher *** 00140 IF (uni .LT. 0.) THEN 00141 uni = uni + 1.0 00142 carry = twom24 00143 ELSE 00144 carry = 0. 00145 ENDIF 00146 seeds(i24) = uni 00147 i24 = i24 - 1 00148 IF (i24 .EQ. 0) i24 = 24 00149 j24 = j24 - 1 00150 IF (j24 .EQ. 0) j24 = 24 00151 rvec(ivec) = uni 00152 C small numbers (with less than 12 "significant" bits) are "padded". 00153 IF (uni .LT. twom12) THEN 00154 rvec(ivec) = rvec(ivec) + twom24*seeds(j24) 00155 C and zero is forbidden in case someone takes a logarithm 00156 IF (rvec(ivec) .EQ. 0.) rvec(ivec) = twom24*twom24 00157 ENDIF 00158 C Skipping to luxury. As proposed by Martin Luscher. 00159 in24 = in24 + 1 00160 IF (in24 .EQ. 24) THEN 00161 in24 = 0 00162 DO 30 isk= 1, nskip 00163 uni = seeds(j24) - seeds(i24) - carry 00164 CCCCCC The above has been corrected 00165 IF (uni .LT. 0.) THEN 00166 uni = uni + 1.0 00167 carry = twom24 00168 ELSE 00169 carry = 0. 00170 ENDIF 00171 seeds(i24) = uni 00172 i24 = i24 - 1 00173 IF (i24 .EQ. 0) i24 = 24 00174 j24 = j24 - 1 00175 IF (j24 .EQ. 0) j24 = 24 00176 30 CONTINUE 00177 ENDIF 00178 40 CONTINUE 00179 RETURN 00180 C 00181 C Entry to input and float integer seeds from previous run 00182 C ENTRY RLUXIN(ISDEXT) 00183 entry xnrnin1(isdext) 00184 twom24 = 1. 00185 DO 50 i= 1, 24 00186 50 twom24 = twom24 * 0.5 00187 twom12 = twom24 * 4096. 00188 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRAND: initialisation with 25 numbers'')') 00189 WRITE(6,'(5X,5I12)') isdext 00190 DO 60 i= 1, 24 00191 seeds(i) = real(isdext(i))*twom24 00192 60 CONTINUE 00193 carry = 0. 00194 IF (isdext(25) .LT. 0) carry = twom24 00195 isd = iabs(isdext(25)) 00196 i24 = mod(isd,100) 00197 isd = isd/100 00198 j24 = mod(isd,100) 00199 isd = isd/100 00200 in24 = mod(isd,100) 00201 isd = isd/100 00202 luxlev = isd 00203 IF (luxlev .LE. maxlev) THEN 00204 nskip = ndskip(luxlev) 00205 WRITE (6,'('' *** XNRAND: level set to '',I2)') luxlev 00206 ELSE IF (luxlev .GE. 24) THEN 00207 nskip = luxlev - 24 00208 WRITE (6,'('' *** XNRAND: p-value set to '',I2)') luxlev 00209 ELSE 00210 nskip = ndskip(maxlev) 00211 WRITE (6,'('' *** XNRAND: illegal level '',I2)') luxlev 00212 luxlev = maxlev 00213 ENDIF 00214 RETURN 00215 C 00216 C Entry to ouput seeds as integers 00217 C ENTRY RLUXUT(ISDEXT) 00218 entry xnrnut1(isdext) 00219 DO 70 i= 1, 24 00220 isdext(i) = int(seeds(i)*twop12*twop12) 00221 70 CONTINUE 00222 isdext(25) = i24 + 100*j24 + 10000*in24 + 1000000*luxlev 00223 IF (carry .GT. 0.) isdext(25) = -isdext(25) 00224 RETURN 00225 C 00226 C Entry to initialize from one integer 00227 C ENTRY RLUXGO(LUX,INSEED) 00228 entry xnrngo1(lux,inseed) 00229 IF (lux .LT. 0) THEN 00230 luxlev = lxdflt 00231 ELSE IF (lux .LE. maxlev) THEN 00232 luxlev = lux 00233 ELSE IF (lux .LT. 24 .OR. lux .GT. 2000) THEN 00234 luxlev = maxlev 00235 WRITE (6,'('' *** XNRNGO: illegal level '',I2)') lux 00236 ELSE 00237 luxlev = lux 00238 DO 80 ilx= 0, maxlev 00239 IF (lux .EQ. ndskip(ilx)+24) luxlev = ilx 00240 80 CONTINUE 00241 ENDIF 00242 IF (luxlev .LE. maxlev) THEN 00243 nskip = ndskip(luxlev) 00244 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRNGO: default level '',I2,'', p '',I4)') 00245 + luxlev, nskip+24 00246 ELSE 00247 nskip = luxlev - 24 00248 WRITE (6,'('' *** XNRNGO: p-value set to '',I2)') luxlev 00249 ENDIF 00250 in24 = 0 00251 IF (inseed .NE. 0) THEN 00252 jseed = inseed 00253 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRNGO: initialised from seed '',I12)')inseed 00254 ELSE 00255 jseed = 314159265 00256 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRNGO: initialised from default seed'')') 00257 ENDIF 00258 notyet = .false. 00259 twom24 = 1. 00260 DO 90 i= 1, 24 00261 twom24 = twom24 * 0.5 00262 k = jseed/53668 00263 jseed = 40014*(jseed-k*53668) -k*12211 00264 IF (jseed .LT. 0) jseed = jseed+icons 00265 iseeds(i) = mod(jseed,itwo24) 00266 90 CONTINUE 00267 twom12 = twom24 * 4096. 00268 DO 100 i= 1,24 00269 seeds(i) = real(iseeds(i))*twom24 00270 100 CONTINUE 00271 i24 = 24 00272 j24 = 10 00273 carry = 0. 00274 IF (seeds(24) .LE. seeds(14)) carry = twom24 00275 END 00276 *CMZ : 1.00/00 16/02/95 11.37.11 by Federico Carminati 00277 *CMZ : 0.03/00 19/01/94 22.39.16 by Federico Carminati 00278 *CMZ : 0.01/01 19/01/94 17.08.37 by Federico Carminati 00279 *-- Author : Federico Carminati 18/01/94 00280 SUBROUTINE xnrand2(RVEC,LENV) 00281 C SUBROUTINE RANLUX(RVEC,LENV) 00282 C Subtract-and-borrow random number generator proposed by 00283 C Marsaglia and Zaman, implemented by F. James with the name 00284 C RCARRY in 1991, and later improved by Martin Luescher 00285 C in 1993 to produce "Luxury Pseudorandom Numbers". 00286 C Fortran 77 coded by F. James, 1993 00287 C 00288 C LUXURY LEVELS. 00289 C ------ ------ The available luxury levels are: 00290 C 00291 C level 0 (p=24): equivalent to the original RCARRY of Marsaglia 00292 C and Zaman, very long period, but fails many tests. 00293 C level 1 (p=48): considerable improvement in quality over level 0, 00294 C now passes the gap test, but still fails spectral test. 00295 C level 2 (p=97): passes all known tests, but theoretically still 00296 C defective. 00297 C level 3 (p=223): DEFAULT VALUE. Any theoretically possible 00298 C correlations have very small chance of being observed. 00299 C level 4 (p=389): highest possible luxury, all 24 bits chaotic. 00300 C 00301 C!!! ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ 00302 C!!! Calling sequences for RANLUX: ++ 00303 C!!! CALL RANLUX (RVEC, LEN) returns a vector RVEC of LEN ++ 00304 C!!! 32-bit random floating point numbers between ++ 00305 C!!! zero (not included) and one (also not incl.). ++ 00306 C!!! CALL RLUXGO(LUX,INT) initializes the generator from one ++ 00307 C!!! 32-bit integer INT and sets Luxury Level LUX ++ 00308 C!!! which is integer between zero and MAXLEV, ++ 00309 C!!! or if LUX .GT. 24, it sets p=LUX directly ++ 00310 C!!! CALL RLUXIN(IVEC) restarts the generator from vector ++ 00311 C!!! IVEC of 25 32-bit integers (see RLUXUT) ++ 00312 C!!! CALL RLUXUT(IVEC) outputs the current values of the 25 ++ 00313 C!!! 32-bit integer seeds, to be used for restarting ++ 00314 C!!! ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ 00315 dimension rvec(lenv) 00316 dimension seeds(24), iseeds(24), isdext(25) 00317 parameter(maxlev=4, lxdflt=3) 00318 dimension ndskip(0:maxlev) 00319 parameter(twop12=4096.) 00320 parameter(itwo24=2**24, icons=2147483563) 00321 SAVE notyet, i24, j24, carry, seeds, twom24, twom12, luxlev 00322 SAVE nskip, ndskip, in24 00323 INTEGER LUXLEV 00324 LOGICAL NOTYET 00325 DATA notyet, luxlev, in24 /.true., lxdflt, 0/ 00326 DATA i24,j24,carry/24,10,0./ 00327 DATA ndskip/0, 24, 73, 199, 365 / 00328 Corresponds to p=24 48 97 223 389 00329 C time factor 1 2 4 9 16 (in practice, much smaller) 00330 C 00331 C NOTYET is .TRUE. if no initialization has been performed yet. 00332 C Default Initialization by Multiplicative Congruential 00333 IF (notyet) THEN 00334 notyet = .false. 00335 jseed = 314159265 00336 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRAND: default initialisation '',I12)') jseed 00337 luxlev = lxdflt 00338 nskip = ndskip(luxlev) 00339 lp = nskip + 24 00340 in24 = 0 00341 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRAND: default level '',I2,'', p '',I4)') 00342 + luxlev, lp 00343 twom24 = 1. 00344 DO 10 i= 1, 24 00345 twom24 = twom24 * 0.5 00346 k = jseed/53668 00347 jseed = 40014*(jseed-k*53668) -k*12211 00348 IF (jseed .LT. 0) jseed = jseed+icons 00349 iseeds(i) = mod(jseed,itwo24) 00350 10 CONTINUE 00351 twom12 = twom24 * 4096. 00352 DO 20 i= 1,24 00353 seeds(i) = real(iseeds(i))*twom24 00354 20 CONTINUE 00355 i24 = 24 00356 j24 = 10 00357 carry = 0. 00358 IF (seeds(24) .LE. seeds(14)) carry = twom24 00359 ENDIF 00360 C 00361 C The Generator proper: "Subtract-with-borrow", 00362 C as proposed by Marsaglia and Zaman, 00363 C Florida State University, March, 1989 00364 C 00365 DO 40 ivec= 1, lenv 00366 CCCCCC This has now been corrected for the bug discovered by Luescher *** 00367 uni = seeds(j24) - seeds(i24) - carry 00368 CCCCCC This has now been corrected for the bug discovered by Luescher *** 00369 IF (uni .LT. 0.) THEN 00370 uni = uni + 1.0 00371 carry = twom24 00372 ELSE 00373 carry = 0. 00374 ENDIF 00375 seeds(i24) = uni 00376 i24 = i24 - 1 00377 IF (i24 .EQ. 0) i24 = 24 00378 j24 = j24 - 1 00379 IF (j24 .EQ. 0) j24 = 24 00380 rvec(ivec) = uni 00381 C small numbers (with less than 12 "significant" bits) are "padded". 00382 IF (uni .LT. twom12) THEN 00383 rvec(ivec) = rvec(ivec) + twom24*seeds(j24) 00384 C and zero is forbidden in case someone takes a logarithm 00385 IF (rvec(ivec) .EQ. 0.) rvec(ivec) = twom24*twom24 00386 ENDIF 00387 C Skipping to luxury. As proposed by Martin Luscher. 00388 in24 = in24 + 1 00389 IF (in24 .EQ. 24) THEN 00390 in24 = 0 00391 DO 30 isk= 1, nskip 00392 uni = seeds(j24) - seeds(i24) - carry 00393 CCCCCC The above has been corrected 00394 IF (uni .LT. 0.) THEN 00395 uni = uni + 1.0 00396 carry = twom24 00397 ELSE 00398 carry = 0. 00399 ENDIF 00400 seeds(i24) = uni 00401 i24 = i24 - 1 00402 IF (i24 .EQ. 0) i24 = 24 00403 j24 = j24 - 1 00404 IF (j24 .EQ. 0) j24 = 24 00405 30 CONTINUE 00406 ENDIF 00407 40 CONTINUE 00408 RETURN 00409 C 00410 C Entry to input and float integer seeds from previous run 00411 C ENTRY RLUXIN(ISDEXT) 00412 entry xnrnin2(isdext) 00413 twom24 = 1. 00414 DO 50 i= 1, 24 00415 50 twom24 = twom24 * 0.5 00416 twom12 = twom24 * 4096. 00417 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRAND: initialisation with 25 numbers'')') 00418 WRITE(6,'(5X,5I12)') isdext 00419 DO 60 i= 1, 24 00420 seeds(i) = real(isdext(i))*twom24 00421 60 CONTINUE 00422 carry = 0. 00423 IF (isdext(25) .LT. 0) carry = twom24 00424 isd = iabs(isdext(25)) 00425 i24 = mod(isd,100) 00426 isd = isd/100 00427 j24 = mod(isd,100) 00428 isd = isd/100 00429 in24 = mod(isd,100) 00430 isd = isd/100 00431 luxlev = isd 00432 IF (luxlev .LE. maxlev) THEN 00433 nskip = ndskip(luxlev) 00434 WRITE (6,'('' *** XNRAND: level set to '',I2)') luxlev 00435 ELSE IF (luxlev .GE. 24) THEN 00436 nskip = luxlev - 24 00437 WRITE (6,'('' *** XNRAND: p-value set to '',I2)') luxlev 00438 ELSE 00439 nskip = ndskip(maxlev) 00440 WRITE (6,'('' *** XNRAND: illegal level '',I2)') luxlev 00441 luxlev = maxlev 00442 ENDIF 00443 RETURN 00444 C 00445 C Entry to ouput seeds as integers 00446 C ENTRY RLUXUT(ISDEXT) 00447 entry xnrnut2(isdext) 00448 DO 70 i= 1, 24 00449 isdext(i) = int(seeds(i)*twop12*twop12) 00450 70 CONTINUE 00451 isdext(25) = i24 + 100*j24 + 10000*in24 + 1000000*luxlev 00452 IF (carry .GT. 0.) isdext(25) = -isdext(25) 00453 RETURN 00454 C 00455 C Entry to initialize from one integer 00456 C ENTRY RLUXGO(LUX,INSEED) 00457 entry xnrngo2(lux,inseed) 00458 IF (lux .LT. 0) THEN 00459 luxlev = lxdflt 00460 ELSE IF (lux .LE. maxlev) THEN 00461 luxlev = lux 00462 ELSE IF (lux .LT. 24 .OR. lux .GT. 2000) THEN 00463 luxlev = maxlev 00464 WRITE (6,'('' *** XNRNGO: illegal level '',I2)') lux 00465 ELSE 00466 luxlev = lux 00467 DO 80 ilx= 0, maxlev 00468 IF (lux .EQ. ndskip(ilx)+24) luxlev = ilx 00469 80 CONTINUE 00470 ENDIF 00471 IF (luxlev .LE. maxlev) THEN 00472 nskip = ndskip(luxlev) 00473 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRNGO: default level '',I2,'', p '',I4)') 00474 + luxlev, nskip+24 00475 ELSE 00476 nskip = luxlev - 24 00477 WRITE (6,'('' *** XNRNGO: p-value set to '',I2)') luxlev 00478 ENDIF 00479 in24 = 0 00480 IF (inseed .NE. 0) THEN 00481 jseed = inseed 00482 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRNGO: initialised from seed '',I12)')inseed 00483 ELSE 00484 jseed = 314159265 00485 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRNGO: initialised from default seed'')') 00486 ENDIF 00487 notyet = .false. 00488 twom24 = 1. 00489 DO 90 i= 1, 24 00490 twom24 = twom24 * 0.5 00491 k = jseed/53668 00492 jseed = 40014*(jseed-k*53668) -k*12211 00493 IF (jseed .LT. 0) jseed = jseed+icons 00494 iseeds(i) = mod(jseed,itwo24) 00495 90 CONTINUE 00496 twom12 = twom24 * 4096. 00497 DO 100 i= 1,24 00498 seeds(i) = real(iseeds(i))*twom24 00499 100 CONTINUE 00500 i24 = 24 00501 j24 = 10 00502 carry = 0. 00503 IF (seeds(24) .LE. seeds(14)) carry = twom24 00504 END 00505 *CMZ : 1.00/00 16/02/95 11.37.11 by Federico Carminati 00506 *CMZ : 0.03/00 19/01/94 22.39.16 by Federico Carminati 00507 *CMZ : 0.01/01 19/01/94 17.08.37 by Federico Carminati 00508 *-- Author : Federico Carminati 18/01/94 00509 SUBROUTINE xnrand3(RVEC,LENV) 00510 C SUBROUTINE RANLUX(RVEC,LENV) 00511 C Subtract-and-borrow random number generator proposed by 00512 C Marsaglia and Zaman, implemented by F. James with the name 00513 C RCARRY in 1991, and later improved by Martin Luescher 00514 C in 1993 to produce "Luxury Pseudorandom Numbers". 00515 C Fortran 77 coded by F. James, 1993 00516 C 00517 C LUXURY LEVELS. 00518 C ------ ------ The available luxury levels are: 00519 C 00520 C level 0 (p=24): equivalent to the original RCARRY of Marsaglia 00521 C and Zaman, very long period, but fails many tests. 00522 C level 1 (p=48): considerable improvement in quality over level 0, 00523 C now passes the gap test, but still fails spectral test. 00524 C level 2 (p=97): passes all known tests, but theoretically still 00525 C defective. 00526 C level 3 (p=223): DEFAULT VALUE. Any theoretically possible 00527 C correlations have very small chance of being observed. 00528 C level 4 (p=389): highest possible luxury, all 24 bits chaotic. 00529 C 00530 C!!! ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ 00531 C!!! Calling sequences for RANLUX: ++ 00532 C!!! CALL RANLUX (RVEC, LEN) returns a vector RVEC of LEN ++ 00533 C!!! 32-bit random floating point numbers between ++ 00534 C!!! zero (not included) and one (also not incl.). ++ 00535 C!!! CALL RLUXGO(LUX,INT) initializes the generator from one ++ 00536 C!!! 32-bit integer INT and sets Luxury Level LUX ++ 00537 C!!! which is integer between zero and MAXLEV, ++ 00538 C!!! or if LUX .GT. 24, it sets p=LUX directly ++ 00539 C!!! CALL RLUXIN(IVEC) restarts the generator from vector ++ 00540 C!!! IVEC of 25 32-bit integers (see RLUXUT) ++ 00541 C!!! CALL RLUXUT(IVEC) outputs the current values of the 25 ++ 00542 C!!! 32-bit integer seeds, to be used for restarting ++ 00543 C!!! ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ 00544 dimension rvec(lenv) 00545 dimension seeds(24), iseeds(24), isdext(25) 00546 parameter(maxlev=4, lxdflt=3) 00547 dimension ndskip(0:maxlev) 00548 parameter(twop12=4096.) 00549 parameter(itwo24=2**24, icons=2147483563) 00550 SAVE notyet, i24, j24, carry, seeds, twom24, twom12, luxlev 00551 SAVE nskip, ndskip, in24 00552 INTEGER LUXLEV 00553 LOGICAL NOTYET 00554 DATA notyet, luxlev, in24 /.true., lxdflt, 0/ 00555 DATA i24,j24,carry/24,10,0./ 00556 DATA ndskip/0, 24, 73, 199, 365 / 00557 Corresponds to p=24 48 97 223 389 00558 C time factor 1 2 4 9 16 (in practice, much smaller) 00559 C 00560 C NOTYET is .TRUE. if no initialization has been performed yet. 00561 C Default Initialization by Multiplicative Congruential 00562 IF (notyet) THEN 00563 notyet = .false. 00564 jseed = 314159265 00565 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRAND: default initialisation '',I12)') jseed 00566 luxlev = lxdflt 00567 nskip = ndskip(luxlev) 00568 lp = nskip + 24 00569 in24 = 0 00570 WRITE(6,'('' *** XNRAND: default level '',I2,'', p '',I4)') 00571 + luxlev, lp 00572 twom24 = 1. 00573 DO 10 i= 1, 24 00574 twom24 = twom24 * 0.5 00575 k = jseed/53668 00576 jseed = 40014*(jseed-k*53668) -k*12211 00577 IF (jseed .LT. 0) jseed = jseed+icons 00578 iseeds(i) = mod(jseed,itwo24) 00579 10 CONTINUE 00580 twom12 = twom24 * 4096. 00581 DO 20 i= 1,24 00582 seeds(i) = real(iseeds(i))*twom24 00583 20 CONTINUE 00584 i24 = 24 00585 j24 = 10 00586 carry = 0. 00587 IF (seeds(24) .LE. seeds(14)) carry = twom24 00588 ENDIF 00589 C 00590 C The Generator proper: "Subtract-with-borrow", 00591 C as proposed by Marsaglia and Zaman, 00592 C Florida State University, March, 1989 00593 C 00594 DO 40 ivec= 1, lenv 00595 CCCCCC This has now been corrected for the bug discovered by Luescher *** 00596 uni = seeds(j24) -
